q: Cher Lloyd remains very grateful to Simon Cowell for giving her a chance on the show and signing her to his Syco label. And she denied reports the pair have clashed over her artistic path, adding: I wouldn't be here without him. Simon Cowell gets me and he's got my back. He knows me too well to give me rules- he likes the fact I'm a bit rebellious! It is amazing just how self-confident Cher Lloyd appears in the super-slick surroundings of LA. Her current lifestyle is a million miles away from her pre-X Factor existence in the backwater of Malvern with mum Dina and

To help goose interest in the spot, Google's generally tight-lipped former CEO Eric Schmidt fired off a note from his personal Twitter feed, hinting to all to watch the Super Bowl, adding Hell has indeed frozen over. Google's spot was a fan favorite of the 110 million viewers of the game last February, many of them returning to watch it again and again on YouTube, where the official upload has almost 6 million views

No Second Thoughts Speaking in an interview with Diane Sawyer of ABC News earlier this week, Donald Rumsfeld put it this way: What you know today can help you unthink your thinking about tomorrow. Her Golden Globe-nominated film The Tourist was panned by critics, but Angelina Jolie says a two-month shoot in Italy with the`` extraordinary'' Johnny Depp was hard to turn down. I got to spend two months in Venice filming, which nobody gets to do, with a co-star who's so much fun and so lovely- it's hard to say no to, Angelina Jolie told radio host Kyle Sandilands yesterday.''( Johnny Depp ) is one of those artists that feels like he's from another time.
